elements.name: terminal-window
elements.description:
A vanilla JavaScript web component that simulates a terminal console with
customizable commands, themes, cursor styles, and typing effects.

attributes.name: typing-speed
attributes.description: Milliseconds per character when typing effect is enabled

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Title displayed in the header bar

attributes.name: show-controls
attributes.description: Show window control buttons (close, minimize, maximize)

attributes.name: show-copy
attributes.description: Show the copy button in the header

attributes.name: max-lines
attributes.description: Maximum number of output lines to keep in buffer

attributes.name: enable-vfs
attributes.description: Enable virtual file system with built-in commands (ls, cd, pwd, mkdir, touch, rm, cat)

attributes.name: persist-history
attributes.description: Persist command history to localStorage across sessions

attributes.name: force-animations
attributes.description: Force typing animations even when user has prefers-reduced-motion set

attributes.name: welcome
attributes.description: Welcome message displayed when terminal loads

slots.name: title
slots.description: Custom content for the terminal title in the header

slots.name: actions
slots.description: Custom buttons/actions before the theme and copy buttons

slots.name: before-output
slots.description: Content inserted before the output area in the terminal body

events.name: command-result
events.description: Fired after a command executes successfully. Detail: { command, args, result }

events.name: command-error
events.description: Fired when a command fails or is not found. Detail: { command, error }

events.name: command
events.description: Fired when a command is executed. Detail: { command, args, input }

events.name: output
events.description: Fired when a line is printed to the terminal. Detail: { type, content }

events.name: copy
events.description: Fired when content is copied to clipboard. Detail: { text, mode }

events.name: close
events.description: Fired when the terminal is closed via the close button

events.name: minimize
events.description: Fired when the terminal is minimized/restored. Detail: { minimized }

events.name: fullscreen
events.description: Fired when fullscreen mode is toggled. Detail: { fullscreen }

properties.name: registerCommand
properties.description:
Register a custom command handler.
The handler receives an array of arguments and the terminal instance,
and can return a string to print, null to suppress output, or a Promise for async commands.

properties.name: unregisterCommand
properties.description: Remove a registered command.

properties.name: registerAlias
properties.description: Create an alias for a command.

properties.name: executeCommand
properties.description: Execute a command string programmatically.

properties.name: executeSequence
properties.description:
Execute multiple commands with delays between them.
Useful for demos, presentations, or scripted terminal sequences.

properties.name: print
properties.description:
Print text to the terminal.
Supports multiple lines (splits on \n) and ANSI color codes.

properties.name: skipTypingEffect
properties.description:
Skip the current typing animation and show all remaining output immediately.
This is also triggered when the user presses Ctrl+C or clicks the terminal during a typing effect.

properties.name: clear
properties.description: Clear all terminal output.

properties.name: scrollToBottom
properties.description:
Force scroll to the bottom of the terminal.
The terminal uses smart auto-scroll: it automatically scrolls when new output appears,
but stops if the user scrolls up to read previous content. This method forces a scroll
and re-enables auto-scroll.

properties.name: setInputMask
properties.description:
Enable or disable input masking for password prompts.
When masked, input is displayed as asterisks (***) instead of the actual characters.

properties.name: copyContent
properties.description: Copy terminal content to clipboard.

properties.name: toggleTheme
properties.description:
Toggle between light and dark theme.
Announces the theme change to screen readers and fires no events (use attribute observation for reactivity).

properties.name: close
properties.description:
Close the terminal by hiding it.
Sets `display: none` on the element and dispatches a `close` event.
The terminal can be shown again by setting `display: block` or removing the style.

properties.name: minimize
properties.description:
Toggle the minimized state of the terminal.
When minimized, only the header is visible. Dispatches a `minimize` event with the new state.

properties.name: toggleFullscreen
properties.description:
Toggle fullscreen mode (maximize).
When fullscreen, the terminal fills the entire viewport. Press Escape to exit.
Dispatches a `fullscreen` event with the new state.

properties.name: setTheme
properties.description: Set the color theme programmatically.

properties.name: setPrompt
properties.description: Set the command prompt text programmatically.

properties.name: setCursorStyle
properties.description: Set the cursor style programmatically.

properties.name: setCursorBlink
properties.description: Enable or disable cursor blinking programmatically.

properties.name: setTypingEffect
properties.description:
Enable or disable the typing effect for output.
When enabled, printed text appears character by character like a typewriter.
Respects `prefers-reduced-motion` unless `force-animations` is set.

properties.name: setReadonly
properties.description:
Enable or disable readonly mode.
When readonly, the input line is hidden and users cannot type commands.
Useful for presentation or demonstration purposes.

properties.name: setForceAnimations
properties.description:
Override the user's `prefers-reduced-motion` system preference.
When forced, typing animations will run even if the user has reduced motion enabled.
Use sparingly and only for testing or when the animation is essential to the experience.

properties.name: hasReducedMotion
properties.description:
Check if the user has enabled `prefers-reduced-motion` in their system settings.
When true, the terminal will skip typing animations unless `force-animations` is set.

properties.name: setI18n
properties.description:
Set internationalization (i18n) strings for localization.
Merges the provided strings with the existing defaults.
Triggers a re-render to apply the new strings.

properties.name: getI18n
properties.description: Get a copy of the current i18n strings configuration.

properties.name: getHistory
properties.description:
Get the command history array.
Returns a copy of the history, not a reference to the internal array.

properties.name: setHistory
properties.description:
Replace the command history with a new array.
Useful for restoring history from storage or initializing with predefined commands.

properties.name: clearHistory
properties.description:
Clear all command history.
If `persist-history` is enabled, also clears the localStorage entry.

properties.name: getContent
properties.description:
Get all terminal output as plain text.
Includes both commands (with prompts) and output lines.

properties.name: focus
properties.description:
Focus the terminal's input field.
Useful after programmatically interacting with the terminal.

properties.name: render
properties.description: Render the component
